body:
This PR proposes to introduce a new subsystem aiming towards providing a generic framework for integrating altnerative transports communications channels inside Bitcoin Core. It showcase a functional proof-of-concept using LN transport protocol as a new link layer for headers fetching. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/18989 for high-level discussion and proposal merits.

## The Design 

Previous [work](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17376) have been attempted towards increasing network security and robustness by increasing communications redundancy. While being optional and fault-tolerant, these attempt don't scale well to integrate a wide-range of alternatives such as [domain-fronting](https://www.bamsoftware.com/papers/fronting/), [orbital communications](https://github.com/Blockstream/satellite), [amateur radio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DASH7), [Tor pluggable transports](https://snowflake.torproject.org/), unlicensed UHF, Bluetooth, [I2P](https://geti2p.net/en/), Lightning[ Noise transport](http://noiseprotocol.org/), ... Each of this transport has its own availability, latency, don't bind to the Berkeley sockets model, be unidirectional, custom peer discovery, not suited for block traffic, ...

This proposal try to overcome this issues by laying out a generic "driver" framework with its own new processing stack, therefore encapsulating per-transport oddities. Specially it introduces:

* Per-transport capabilities (`TransportCapabilities`). Originally declared by each driver, they abstract driver specifities to general flags, like directionality, protocol messages scope. They could be extended with further attributes, like max bandwidth for adjusted packing or "privacy"/"trustness" niceness of the link.
* Abstract driver model (`CDriver`). Quite basic, it dissociate driver warmup, message preprocessing, sending and reception. Ideally you may want to load them dynamically.
* "Anycast" header-fetching (`AltLogicValidation::BlockHeaderAnomalie`). After notification from the [watchdog module](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18987), it sends a `GETHEADERS` message to any peers supporting bidirectionality and headers processing.
* Alternative processing stack (`AltLogicValidation`). Relying on its own threads, it manages drivers and may take action based on static logical capabilites instead of peer state, therefore reducing likeliness of bugs. In the future you may implement inside more robust headers-sync strategy like reverse-header or compressed headers. It may also leverage a [future asynchronous validation interface](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18963).

Advantages of such design, it should be easy to integrate new drivers binding to abstract class, easy to reason on due to logical capabilites and at the same time provide a high-level of tuning due to fine-integration with rpc. Peer discovery and policy or bandwidth/memory DoS-protection could be made inside the driver. You can also envision rpc like `sendemergencytx`, brodacasting a transaciton on any transport protocol available, like a [LN's justice transaction](https://github.com/lightningnetwork/lightning-rfc/blob/master/05-onchain.md#revoked-transaction-close-handling) after a detection of being eclipsed.

Module could be made entirely optional at compile-time with `--enable-altnet` even if such integration with the build system hasn't been made.

Obviously this is an exploratory PoC, I don't expect code here to be merged at all. Beyond worthiness of doing this in Rust IMO, there is a lot of question to talk about, among others threading/memory model, interface with existing codebase, build system, resources consumption, fault-tolerance. After writing this, I would favor building on the multiprocss work and hosting this new network stack in its own to avoid any bug contamination from likely complex driver. Higher level motivation and design discussion may be deferred to linked issue

## The Demo

This PoC features a header-fetching round-trip, leveraging LN connection protocol. Each LN node connects to its peers through an encrypted and authenticated channel. As you LN peer must have a chain access, you may leverage this privileged link to get a redundant chain access. 

Using C-lightninng [custom LN message support](https://github.com/ElementsProject/lightning/pull/3315) and [plugin API](https://github.com/ElementsProject/lightning/blob/master/doc/PLUGINS.md), we may embed directly inside `HEADERS`/`GETHEADERS` and realize a round-trip between 2 disconnected bitcoin nodes through their respective C-lightning nodes.

You must compile and run 2 C-lightning nodes, each with its own data directory. They must be launched with this [custom bridge plugin](https://github.com/ariard/bridge-layer). Once getting LN nodes running, activate bridges by `lightning-cli alice_on` and `lightning-cli bob_on`, plugin don't seem to accept CLI argument so had to hardcode some node addresses.

Then compile 2 bitcoin nodes with this patchset. For one of them you must change hardcoded port in C-lightning driver and desactivate watchdog logic. Note, change also `SCAN_INTERVAL` to something reasonable.

High-level setup:


                                                 -->

                    __________          LN_msg(`GETHEADERS`)                   ________
                   |          |                                               |        |
                   | CL-Alice |-----------------------------------------------| CL-Bob |
                   |__________|                                               |________|           
                        |               LN_msg(`HEADERS`)                         |
                    ____|_____                                                 ___|_____
                   |          |                 <--                           |         |
                   |  bridge  |                                               | bridge  |
                   |__________|                                               |_________|
                        |                                                         |
                    ____|_____                                                 ___|____
                   |          |                                               |        |
                   | BC-Alice |                                               | BC-Bob |
                   |__________|                                               |________|

                      HEIGHT                                                   HEIGH + 1



Running both nodes, they should automatically connect to the bridge, and after anomalie detection realize a header exchange, if one of them is at least one block forward (run `generatetoaddress 1 $ADDR`).

title: RFC: Introducing AltNet, a pluggable framework for alternative transports
